New Records: Virgil van Dijk received two yellow cards and was sent off, becoming the third Netherlands player to be dismissed in the Nations League since its inception.
Denzel Dumfries scored an equalizer with a header from Cody Gakpo's free-kick, marking his first goal for the Netherlands since his debut in 2018.
Key Match Events: The Netherlands equalized in the 88th minute through Denzel Dumfries' header after Virgil van Dijk's red card.
Hungary took the lead in the 32nd minute with a well-taken goal by Roland Sallai, their first against the Netherlands in 40 years.
Pre-Game Insights: The Netherlands dominated possession with over 80% in the first half but struggled to break down Hungary's defense.
Hungary focused on counter-attacks, with Roland Sallai twice testing the Netherlands goalkeeper with shots on target.
Post-Match Reflections: Netherlands coach Ronald Koeman expressed frustration over Van Dijk's red card and the team's inability to convert chances.
Germany's Deniz Undav scored twice in six minutes to secure a 2-1 win over Bosnia and Herzegovina, keeping them top of their Nations League group.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in front of a packed Budapest Arena with over 20,000 fans in attendance.
Hungary ended a nine-match losing streak against the Netherlands, who had previously won all 39 meetings before this game.
Others: The match was part of the 2024-25 Nations League campaign, with both teams aiming for a spot in the final tournament.
